data.title: Windows GL does not build - incorrect deps head
data.body: Recent changes to the Windows GL side of MonoGame seem to require changes from OpenTK 1.1.2. That library is in a commit in the dependencies module that is after the current head pushed by Tom a few days ago.

data.title: SDL_mixer on Linux platform
data.body:
What is the use of [SDL_mixer](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Desktop/OpenTKGamePlatform.cs#L111-L112) on the Linux platform? This appears to be initialized on startup but never actually used.

Is there a reason to keep this here, or is it just a dead dependency that was never removed?

data.title: Implemented GraphicsAdapter.IsWideScreen
data.body: This implementation matches XNA behavior on the desktop. Mobile platforms that support display orientation require more testing.

data.title: Return guide to windows phone
data.body:
Updated ProtoBuild
MonoGame.Framework now aliased in WP project to avoid conflict with MS.XNA
Updated Guide class to use new extern
Removed GamerServices extern from MG base

data.title: IsRunningSlowly is almost always true
data.body:
This is a carry on of some off topic chat in #2578 

Grab this test project, put it beside a MonoGame repo and run the GL version
https://github.com/danzel/DrawTextTest

"The game is running slow" will be shown 99+% of the time. But the game is still hitting 58-60fps.

When we are asking for 60FPS, a whole Update, Draw, Present will take at least 1/60th of a second (Present will wait for vsync, which guarantees this). So when we check how long since the last update, it will have been at least the TargetElapsedTime (1/60th of a second).

You can put a stopwatch around Present to see we are spending ~15ms waiting for vsync
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/GraphicsDevice.OpenGL.cs#L403

I think we should not count time waiting for vsync as part of our running slowly measurement. Thoughts?

Similar behaviour happens on DX, but it doesn't always say we are running slowly, I'm not really sure why.
Windows 8.1, Intel 3000 gfx.

data.title: SDL2.dll missing and  vshost32.exe crush (develop branch win gl version)
data.body:
seems current develop branch win gl version requires SDL2.dll
I downloaded 2.0.3 from http://www.libsdl.org/download-2.0.php

but at window.ProcessEvents(); execution in

>   MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.OpenTKGameWindow.Run() Line 365  C#

VS debugger (vshost32.exe) crashed.

Am I using the correct version sdl2.dll ?

data.title: Page URLs for Documentation
data.body:
This PR adds support for page specific URLs to the documentation style.  For example:

  http://www.monogame.net/documentation/?page=N_Microsoft_Xna_Framework
  http://www.monogame.net/documentation/?page=M_Microsoft_Xna_Framework_BoundingBox_Equals
  http://www.monogame.net/documentation/?page=T_Microsoft_Xna_Framework_Color
  http://www.monogame.net/documentation/?page=api
  http://www.monogame.net/documentation/?page=2mgfx_md

This could still be better if we tried to reduce the URL size as some of them can get crazy:

  http://www.monogame.net/documentation/?page=M_Microsoft_Xna_Framework_Content_Pipeline_Serialization_Compiler_ContentCompiler_Compile

... not sure yet what to do about that.

I could also maybe move to support "url mod rewrite" so we could have this:

  http://www.monogame.net/documentation/T_Microsoft_Xna_Framework_Color/

... but it doesn't seem worth it to me.

data.title: Angle build uses Windows Lidgren
data.body: The protobuild output for the Angle platform generates a reference to the Windows version of Lidgren. Is this intentional?

data.title: Building WindowsGL Content
data.body:
So currently our `TargetPlatform` enum for the new content pipeline looks like this:

```
    public enum TargetPlatform
    {
        Windows,
        Xbox360,
        WindowsPhone,
        iOS,
        Android,
        Linux,
        MacOSX,
        WindowsStoreApp,
        NativeClient,
        Ouya,
        PlayStationMobile,
        WindowsPhone8,
        RaspberryPi,
        PlayStation4,
    }
```

The problem here is that `Windows` currently builds for DirectX content.  So what do you specify when you need content for the WindowsGL platform?  While most of the content works fine, Effects for DirectX vs OpenGL are completely different.

Should we just make `WindowsGL` a new value in `TargetPlatform`?

data.title: Model importer and processor improvements
data.body:
I've addressed some bugs with model importing and processing, now the output looks much closer to XNA. It can properly build the dude and ship assets from XNA samples, so long as the source files are updated to the newer FBX versions first. This should also resolve #2182, which had a missing triangles problem.

I also filled in some of the gaps for material processing necessary to get things building and models written out, so the ModelProcessor properly chains to build materials and textures.

data.title: 2MGFX failing to compile shader when there's more than one sampler
data.body:
This took me a while to figure out: when 2MGFX it calls MarshalHelper.UnmarshalArray<T>() for type MojoShader.MOJOSHADER_sampler, and "count" is greater than 1, it runs into an AccessViolationException when I run it in Visual Studio with native code debugging enabled.

I'd guess that it's because UnmarshalArray<T>() always assumes that each sampler value is exactly 24 bytes long, wereas in actuality might be completely different because of the String value in the sampler type. I'm not sure if this is it, though; all I can tell is that it works fine if there are either 0 or 1 elements in the array, but it screws up on the second element.

(For the record, it's used in a shader which samples two textures: one for the texture itself, and one for normal mapping. It also worked fine in a prevous version of 2MGFX, though I haven't a clue how far back or what the difference in functionality is.)

data.title: Installer Fix for 2MGFX
data.body: This fixes the installer which was pointing to the old 2MGFX build location.

data.title: GraphicsDevice depends on the Game class
data.body:
recent changes (b36884c65b4885eb097a1d5455d6ee5f72ab2429) in GraphicsDevice.OpenGL.cs not allow to use custom winforms control for rendering. 

To render to custom winfroms control we in our project do not use Game class. 

But with recent changes we must use the Game and OpenTKGameWindow classes.

example: http://jaquadro.com/2013/04/monogame-winforms-repository/

data.title: Improve mouse input on WindowsGL and Linux
data.body:
This PR updates mouse input to match XNA on WindowsGL, Linux and Angle and removes all platform-specific hacks the were previously required.

More specifically:
- WindowsGL functioned correctly before, so this PR simply removes the win32 DllImports in favor of cross-platform code.
- Linux had a number of issues with `Mouse.SetPosition`; cursor jumps when toggling IsMouseVisible; no mouse input outside the GameWindow. All issues are now fixed, and the platform-specific hacks have been removed.
- Angle functions identically to WindowsGL.
- `Mouse.WindowHandle` now correctly returns the handle for the `GameWindow`. This improves consistency with XNA but serves little purpose in a cross-platform application.

Finally, this PR implicitly allows WindowsGL to run on Mac OS X.

Affects issue #2464

data.title: Tnc vertex declaration reflection helpers is value type
MonoGameContentProcessors DxtCompressed iOS bug
data.body:
Hi,

I am using MonoGameContentProcessors for building my game content for iOS. This used to work fine, but now I use  DxTCompressed as texture format. Now it does not seem to build one file. I have uploaded it here, so you can take a look (https://onedrive.live.com/redir?resid=C0CE760A348CC8BF!7446&authkey=!ANpmIJWBflfL4js&ithint=file%2c.dds). This file builds fine with XNA for Windows (& Phone). This is the error Visual Studio throws when attempting to build it:

Error   3   Building content threw NotSupportedException: Specified method is not supported.
   at MonoGameContentProcessors.Processors.MGTextureProcessor.Process(TextureContent input, ContentProcessorContext context) in E:\MonoGame\MonoGame\MonoGame.ContentPipeline\ContentProcessors\Processors\MGTextureProcessor.cs:line 98
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessor`2.Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.IContentProcessor.Process(Object input, ContentProcessorContext context)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.BuildCoordinator.BuildAssetWorker(BuildItem item)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.BuildCoordinator.BuildAsset(BuildItem item)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.BuildCoordinator.RunTheBuild()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Tasks.BuildContent.RemoteProxy.RunTheBuild(BuildCoordinatorSettings settings, TimestampCache timestampCache, ITaskItem[] sourceAssets, String[]& outputContent, String[]& rebuiltContent, String[]& intermediates, Dictionary`2& dependencyTimestamps, KeyValuePair`2[]& warnings)   E:\Felicity\Wheelom Content\Textures\Old Tiles\Cracked.dds  ContentBuilder

Thanks for the great efforts that you guys make,
Christian

data.title: Write TouchPanel Unit Tests
data.body: We need to write some unit tests into the existing testing framework to validate functionality of the `TouchPanel` system.  Ideally we could run the same tests on MonoGame as well as XNA to validate functionality, but the only place this could run is on Windows Phone 8.

data.title: DrawString is 10x slower than xna DrawString
data.body:
Hi, 
I was testing my XNA gameengine with Monogame and got some strange peformance issues. I profiled it with the ANTS Performance Profiler and see that the drawString method is the root of all evil. In 550 hit counts the DrawString method needs 0.137 seconds in Monogame but only 0.011 seconds in XNA.

data.title: Combine new URI("file:///" ...) code
data.body:
We use it to combine paths by the looks, I'm not totally sure why:
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Content/ContentReader.cs#L149-L162
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Content/ContentReaders/SongReader.cs#L67-L83

And TitleContainer uses it for some sort of path normalization:
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/TitleContainer.cs#L149-L152

If anyone knows the reasons behind these that'd be great, otherwise I'll dig around :)

data.title: Remove FileHelpers that are not needed
data.body:
I've removed all methods from FileHelpers that only have one place we can use them.
They are from StorageContainer / TitleContainer mostly.

NormalizeFilePathSeparators remains, in the future something to tidy up the "file:///" code we have in the code base should go in here too, I don't understand it enough yet to do it.

Here is the places all of the functions came from:

FileExists: From MetroHelper.AppDataFileExists
FileOpenRead: TitleContainer.OpenStream
NormalizeFilename: ContentTypeReader.Normalize
SeekStreamToStart: ContentManager.GetContentReaderFromXnb `#if ANDROID` section.
DirectoryExists: StorageContainer.DirectoryExists
DirectoryGetFiles: StorageContainer.GetFileNames
DirectoryGetDirectories: StorageContainer.GetDirectoryNames
DirectoryCreate: StorageContainer.CreateDirectory
DirectoryDelete: StorageContainer.DeleteDirectory
GetInstallPath: TitleContainer.Location
OpenStream: ContentManager.OpenStream
StreamClose: Unused
FileDelete: StorageContainer.DeleteFile
FileCreate: StorageContainer.CreateFile
FileOpen: StorageContainer.OpenFile
OpenStreamAsync: TItleContainer.OpenStreamAsync

data.title: Fixed broken SoundEffectInstance.IsLooped on Android.
Dependencies Update
data.body: Latest dependencies with a CppSharp update.

data.title: Make use of FileHelpers.NormalizeFilePathSeparators
data.body:
First part of the FileHelpers things for #2555

This is an easy one that makes a nice cleanup, so submitting it by itself.

The remaining FileHelpers are mostly just used by StorageDevice, so maybe we leave them for now as #2389 is going to tackle them.
If you do plan on using the code in there, `DirectoryGetFiles` and `DirectoryGetDirectories` both ignore the given path on WINDOWS_STOREAPP.
It looks like this bug was copy/pasted out of StorageDevice.
(I'll send a PR to fix them when I get a chance.)

data.title: Use ReflectionHelpers
data.body:
Use the ReflectionHelpers methods rather than having #if code everywhere.

Shouldn't change any behaviour except the following commit: c99103b5e435a15fa24b0ea89f9bf4b2261f35a9
I believe this is correct now, please see the comments on the commit.

refs #2555
